Comment.value: when Illithid sees pc, he should shout this as he attacks.

value.0: "You have come right to me, like a pathetic fool, <race> scum! Today I rise and you shall die..." It seems strange to see your adversary without his mask but you know beyond a shadow of a doubt that it is him. If nothing else, you recognize the voice.
"I have found your mind again. How did you manage to hide from me? Your kind are usually easy prey for my powers."
"Indeed. If you are to reach me, you will have to kill some of your own kind... my thralls will protect me with their lives. I will --" Once again the voice is cut off.
"Sorry about that. I was speaking to someone else and it got through my defenses. I'll try not to let it happen again."
"A good idea. I wonder what surprises it has in store for you."
"Slaves that an illithid captures have their minds stripped and they become willing servants of the illithid. The creature probably has quite a few peasants in its army, but nothing to worry about."
"I will do my best. It was an unfortunate slip, but I don't think it really hurt you. The creature is just trying to intimidate you."
"Your grandmother. She is eager to speak to you again, if you can kill the illithid. I can tell you no more than that, so don't even ask."

"You have entered my caves. Do you actually dare to test your puny strength against my own might and the might of my entire army?" You look around but see nothing. The Masked Man's voice is still only in your head, even here.
"You are a fool and you will writhe in pain, screaming for mercy and death, but in the end you will join me and serve me as..."
Suddenly the voice is cut off and the voice of your weapon enters your mind...
"Well, that will be just about enough out of him. Arrogant creatures, these illithid."
"We are getting close to it. I didn't want the illithid to gain any insights into your mind. It will be hard enough to beat without giving up any more advantages."
"Yes. He knows you are coming, so I suggest you move quickly. There must be a way to avoid the main mass of its army, or to make a distraction."
"Yes, our good old friend the Masked Man. Ugly creatures. Fully convinced of their own superiority. I killed a few of them, back when I was alive."
"But no time to speak of that now. He knows you are coming, so I suggest you move quickly. There must be a way to avoid the main mass of its army, or to make a distraction."
"Look around carefully. I'm sure you can find a way."
"Let's get going."
"What are thralls?"
"Make sure you don't."
"Who were you speaking to?"
"Thanks for shutting it out."
"Why did you cut us off? I was enjoying that."
"I'll enjoy killing it."
"He knows we're here."

Comment.value: if PC has never used the illithid gems.

value.0: "That was an illithid?"
